Chessboard

Class Chessboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Chessboard.Chessboard

  • public class Chessboard
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class contain a two dimensional Piece-object array, which contains the chess pieces situated at the chessboard in formation of the current chess game position. Instances also contain: - each colour's pieces in a List-object - integer marking the current position of kings - integer containing the amount of current white and black officers

                              Piece newPiece)
        Switches piece-object into another. Used in promoting pawn to queen.
        Parameters:
        oldPiece - Piece-object, old piece to be promoted.
        newPiece - Piece-object, new piece, replaces the old one.
        Returns:

      • updatePiecePosition

        protected boolean updatePiecePosition(int startPosition,
                                      int endPosition)
        Updates piece's position at the board. Piece to be moved is at the startPosition.
        Parameters:
        startPosition - Integer, position of the piece, 0 = top left, 63 = bottom right.
        endPosition - Integer, position, where the piece is to be moved. 0 = top left, 63 = bottom right.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true, if update is successful, false otherwise.

      • updatePiecePosition

        protected boolean updatePiecePosition(Piece piece,
                                      int endPosition)
        Updates piece's position at the board. Piece to be moved is at the startPosition.
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece-object, which information (e.g. position) is to be updated.
        endPosition - Integer, position, where the piece is to be moved. 0 = top left, 63 = bottom right.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true, if update is successful, false otherwise.

        Returns one piece from the correct list.
        Parameters:
